item.title: “Research Tools & Techniques” Symposium Scheduled for October 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Discover the magic of research tools with the Graduate Student Council’s upcoming symposium in the CBIS Auditorium that will explore essential apps, workflows, and services that streamline your graduate studies and your personal life. item.title: “Revisiting ChatBS, the R-powered LLM Exploratory Sandbox” Topic of RPIrates Monthly Meeting
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the October meeting of RPIrates, the RPI R users group, which will take place at 6:00PM on Wednesday, October 2 in Amos Eaton 217. ChatBS is an accessible, R Shiny-based platform for interactive experimentation with LLMs, including GPT 4 variants and Llama3; in this session, Dr. John Erickson will review ChatBS, demo its capabilities, and highlight aspects of interest to R coders, including the development and deployment of R Shiny apps.

item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 - Tue , October 15, 2024 (all day) - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.

item.title: RPI Welcomes “Hacker in Residence”
item.description: Jeremy Blackthorne, M.S. ’15 is co-founder and CEO of Boston Cybernetics Institute, a public benefit corporation with the mission of promoting and providing cybersecurity education in support of national defense. Beginning this fall, Blackthorne also joined RPI as a visiting scientist with a special designation as the inaugural “hacker in residence.”
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Space Science and Technology Day Lifts Off
item.description: Rensselaer has long been at the forefront of space exploration and discovery, and on September 30, that storied legacy met the future at RPI’s Space Science and Technology Day. As part of the Institute’s year-long Bicentennial celebration honoring RPI’s rich history and the promising years to come, the event invited the Capital Region community to hear from alumni, students, and researchers propelling humanity’s space endeavors.

item.title: Fac/Staff Webinar, “Tips for Improving Online Breakout Room Sessions,” Scheduled for October 4
item.description: Date: Friday, October 4, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this webinar, which will review tips and tricks to creating more productive breakout sessions, participants will not learn “how to” use the breakout room feature in Webex, but how to improve the engagement in such sessions by offering roles, mixing things up, and creating connections. Please register if you plan to participate!
